prompt: Create a command structure for a team project with separate commands for frontend, backend, and database operations
response:
I'll help you create a command structure for a team project with separate commands for frontend, backend, and database operations. I'll use the best practices from the Command Development skill to organize the commands.

Project Structure:
```
.claude/commands/
├── frontend/
│   ├── build.md
│   ├── lint.md
│   ├── test.md
│   └── serve.md
├── backend/
│   ├── build.md
│   ├── test.md
│   ├── migrate.md
│   └── seed.md
└── database/
    ├── backup.md
    ├── restore.md
    └── reset.md
```

I'll create the command files with appropriate YAML frontmatter and instructions:

1. Frontend Build Command (`frontend/build.md`):
```markdown
---
description: Build frontend application
allowed-tools: Bash(npm:*)
argument-hint: [environment]
---

Environment: ${1:-development}

Build frontend for $1 environment:
!`npm run build:$1`

Verify build artifacts:
- Check dist/ directory contents
- Validate build output
- Run initial health checks
```

2. Frontend Lint Command (`frontend/lint.md`):
```markdown
---
description: Lint frontend code
allowed-tools: Bash(npm:*)
---

Run comprehensive frontend linting:
!`npm run lint`

Analyze linting results:
- Identify code style issues
- Check for potential errors
- Suggest improvements
```

3. Frontend Test Command (`frontend/test.md`):
```markdown
---
description: Run frontend tests
allowed-tools: Bash(npm:*)
argument-hint: [test-pattern]
---

Run frontend tests${1:+ matching "$1"}:
!`npm run test${1:+ -- --grep "$1"}`

Test coverage analysis:
- Report total coverage percentage
- Highlight areas needing more tests
- Identify critical path coverage
```

4. Frontend Serve Command (`frontend/serve.md`):
```markdown
---
description: Start frontend development server
allowed-tools: Bash(npm:*)
argument-hint: [port]
---

Start development server${1:+ on port $1}:
!`npm run start${1:+ -- --port $1}`

Server startup checks:
- Verify server is running
- Check available endpoints
- Display local access URL
```

5. Backend Build Command (`backend/build.md`):
```markdown
---
description: Build backend application
allowed-tools: Bash(npm:*, mvn:*, gradle:*)
argument-hint: [environment]
---

Environment: ${1:-development}

Build backend for $1 environment:
!`npm run build:$1`  # or appropriate build command

Verify build:
- Check build artifacts
- Validate compilation
- Run initial sanity checks
```

6. Backend Test Command (`backend/test.md`):
```markdown
---
description: Run backend tests
allowed-tools: Bash(npm:*)
argument-hint: [test-type]
---

Run backend tests${1:+ for "$1"}:
!`npm run test${1:+ -- --type "$1"}`

Test analysis:
- Total test count
- Passed/Failed breakdown
- Coverage report
```

7. Backend Migrate Command (`backend/migrate.md`):
```markdown
---
description: Run database migrations
allowed-tools: Bash(npm:*)
argument-hint: [migration-type]
---

Perform ${1:-latest} database migrations:
!`npm run migrate${1:+ -- --type "$1"}`

Migration checks:
- Validate migration status
- Check for potential conflicts
- Verify schema changes
```

8. Backend Seed Command (`backend/seed.md`):
```markdown
---
description: Seed database with test data
allowed-tools: Bash(npm:*)
argument-hint: [environment]
---

Seed ${1:-development} database:
!`npm run seed:$1`

Seed verification:
- Count inserted records
- Validate data integrity
- Check for any seed errors
```

9. Database Backup Command (`database/backup.md`):
```markdown
---
description: Create database backup
allowed-tools: Bash(*)
argument-hint: [backup-name]
---

Backup database${1:+ as "$1"}:
!`./scripts/backup.sh${1:+ "$1"}`

Backup details:
- Backup file location
- Timestamp
- Size of backup
```

10. Database Restore Command (`database/restore.md`):
```markdown
---
description: Restore database from backup
allowed-tools: Bash(*)
argument-hint: [backup-file]
---

Restore database from $1:
!`./scripts/restore.sh "$1"`

Restoration checks:
- Verify backup file exists
- Check restoration success
- Validate restored data integrity
```

11. Database Reset Command (`database/reset.md`):
```markdown
---
description: Reset database to clean state
allowed-tools: Bash(*)
argument-hint: [environment]
---

Reset ${1:-development} database:
!`./scripts/reset.sh${1:+ "$1"}`

Reset verification:
- Confirm database is empty
- Check default configurations
- Validate reset process
```

This command structure provides:
- Clear separation of concerns
- Consistent naming
- Flexible argument handling
- Environment-aware operations
- Built-in verification steps

Usage examples:
```
> /frontend:build staging
> /backend:test integration
> /database:backup production-backup
> /frontend:serve 3000
```

Recommendations:
1. Adjust build/test commands to match your specific project setup
2. Ensure corresponding scripts exist in your project
3. Update allowed tools based on your tech stack
4. Add more specific error handling as needed

Would you like me to elaborate on any part of this command structure or explain any specific aspect in more detail?
